dir=\"auto\"\u003eIt is inspired by \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/jhnns/rewire\"\u003erewire.js\u003c/a\u003e and transfers its concepts to es6 using babel.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIt is useful for writing tests, specifically to mock the dependencies of the module under test.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTherefore for each module it adds and exports the methods \u003ccode\u003e__GetDependency__\u003c/code\u003e, \u003ccode\u003e__Rewire__\u003c/code\u003e, and \u003ccode\u003e__ResetDependency__\u003c/code\u003e.\nFor compatibility reasons with rewire.js, the methods \u003ccode\u003e__get__\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003e__set__\u003c/code\u003e are exported as well.\nFrom version 1.0.0-rc-7 on calls to \u003ccode\u003e__set__\u003c/code\u003e will return a revert function like rewire.js.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThese methods allow you to rewire the module under test.\nFurthermore in case of a default export these methods are assigned to the existing default export, except for default exports of primitive types (boolean, number, string, ...).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAn additional object named \u003ccode\u003e__RewireAPI__\u003c/code\u003e is exported as named export as well as a property of the default export. This object itself contains all the functions mentioned above as fields. This enables one to rewire members of the imported module itself without explicitly importing the module (see \u003ca href=\"#handling-of-default-exports\"\u003eHandling of default exports\u003c/a\u003e below).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eES6 Imports and Since isparta runs Babel itself it's important to remember to add the same configuration options to it as you would do with Babel. If you forget this you will in some cases see unexpected errors.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you use \u003cem\u003e.babelrc\u003c/em\u003e it's advised that you run your tests with a specific ENV, for example \"test\", and add the following to your \u003cem\u003e.babelrc\u003c/em\u003e.\nFurthermore in case you use isparta only add the plugin once in the isparta loader and not in the babel loader as well.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"\u0026quot;env\u0026quot;: {\n  \u0026quot;test\u0026quot;: {\n    \u0026quot;plugins\u0026quot;: [\u0026quot;rewire\u0026quot;]\n  }\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"env\"\u003c/span\u003e: {\n  \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"test\"\u003c/span\u003e: {\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"plugins\"\u003c/span\u003e: [\u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003erewire\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e]\n  }\n}\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf you are using isparta together with Webpack you could also do dependencies\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.2 Added __set__ and __get__ to provide compatibility with rewire.js\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.3 Added handling for the export of named declarations like classes or functions\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.4 Fixed variable handling and used renaming of scope variables. Further removed global identifiers to prevent memory leaks.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.5 Fixed regression\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.6 Support for rewiring top level variables. Added module.exports for non-es6 modules.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.7 Fixed regressions from 0.1.6.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.8 Ignores destructuring assignments to prevent errors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.9 Removed issues with TDZ and es6.spec.blockScoping optional transformer.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.10 Fixed tests.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.11 Fixed issues with for-of loops.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.12 Updated Plugin Format.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.13 Changed rewire specific properties on default export to non-enumerable properties.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.14 Added handling for non-enumerable properties to commonjs support. Support for mixed es6 and commonjs support. Handling for primitive types.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.15 Added functionality to rewire functions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.16 Fixed variable scope for rewired functions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.17 Fixed variable scoping for var variable declarations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.18 Fixed function scope for rewired functions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.19 Removed debug statements.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.20 Added rewiring named exported functions and variables.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.21 Improved default export handling, fixed commonjs default exporting, fixed ast nodes resource leaks, improved README.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.22 Added support for asynchronous functions\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e0.1.23-beta Improved flow compatibility, Added functionality to work with cyclic dependencies.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-beta-1 Added support for babel 6, added support for rewiring classes, added support for flow types, added support for rewire.js compatible _\u003cem\u003ewith_\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-beta-2 Removed rewire of Object, require\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-beta-3 Removed support for rewiring of globals. Added support for rewiring in combination with assignment and update expressions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-beta-4 Updates jsx support in combination with babel 6 but has a regression\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-beta-5 Fixes rewiring of jsx elements. Readme improvements. Test for pass-through like modules.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-rc-1 Fixes rewiring of switch statements. Readme improvements. Wildcard imports and tdz issues.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-rc-2 Fixes issues with babelify, React stateless functions as well as flow declarations.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-rc-3 Added support for ignoring identifiers and support for objects as parameter to _\u003cem\u003eset_\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-rc-4 Support for rewiring to undefined, suppport for should.js and cleaned up package.json.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-rc-5 Improved support for rewiring JSX-Components. Further improved for working in combination with other plugins.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-rc-6 Fixed regression which can occur with variable declarators and function expressions. Fixed handling of default exports containing nested functions.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0-rc-7 Added revert function as a return of _\u003cem\u003eset_\u003c/em\u003e calls.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.0.0 Fixed regression with object methods and improved istanbul documentation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e1.2.0-rc.1 Add support for babel 7, object spread and revert function from __set__ with object and fixes undefined variable error\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eContributors\u003c/h2\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-contributors\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Contributors\" href=\"#contributors\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://github.com/speedskater\"\u003espeedskater\u003c/a\u003e - id="user-content-babel-plugin-rewire" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: babel-plugin-rewire" href="#babel-plugin-rewire"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">A Babel plugin that adds the ability to rewire module dependencies.</p><p dir="auto"><a href="https://travis-ci.org/speedskater/babel-plugin-rewire" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/4668c8d60d4701a79f236f4604f869607ddb5ef27824f9cdc45a39c9636e1ca2/68747470733a2f2f7472617669732d63692e6f72672f7370656564736b617465722f626162656c2d706c7567696e2d7265776972652e737667" alt="Build Status" data-canonical-src="https://travis-ci.org/speedskater/babel-plugin-rewire.svg" style="max-width: 100%;"></a> <a href="https://gitter.im/speedskater/babel-plugin-rewire?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=badge" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/2da7039d862cabe847953554272000b86e80b158a0723c9a832720b935df3f43/68747470733a2f2f6261646765732e6769747465722e696d2f4a6f696e253230436861742e737667" alt="Join the chat at https://gitter.im/speedskater/babel-plugin-rewire" data-canonical-src="https://badges.gitter.im/Join%20Chat.svg" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto">It is inspired by <a href="https://github.com/jhnns/rewire">rewire.js</a> and transfers its concepts to es6 using babel.</p><p dir="auto">It is useful for writing tests, specifically to mock the dependencies of the module under test.</p><p dir="auto">Therefore for each module it adds and exports the methods <code>__GetDependency__</code>, <code>__Rewire__</code>, and <code>__ResetDependency__</code>.For compatibility reasons with rewire.js, the methods <code>__get__</code> and <code>__set__</code> are exported as well.From version 1.0.0-rc-7 on calls to <code>__set__</code> will return a revert function like rewire.js.</p><p dir="auto">These methods allow you to rewire the module under test.Furthermore in case of a default export these methods are assigned to the existing default export, except for default exports of primitive types (boolean, number, string, ...).</p><p dir="auto">An additional object named <code>__RewireAPI__</code> is exported as named export as well as a property of the default export. This object itself contains all the functions mentioned above as fields. This enables one to rewire members of the imported module itself without explicitly importing the module (see <a href="#handling-of-default-exports">Handling of default exports</a> below).</p><div top level functions defined in the imported module can be rewired.</p><p dir="auto">When exported functions of a module depend on each other it can be convenient to test them independently.Hence, babel-plugin-rewire allows you to rewire the internal dependencies to exported named functions as shown in the example below.</p><p dir="auto">Be aware, that rewiring a named export does not influence imports of that same export in other modules!</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Example</h3><a id="user-content-example-2" primitive default export is present in the imported module, it is enriched with the API-Functions and the API-Object.If no default export is present, the API-Object named <code>__RewireAPI__</code> becomes the default export of the module.</p><p dir="auto">This object basically supports all the rewire API-Functions as described in the introduction above and allows one to rewire the module without explicitly importing the module itself.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Example</h3><a id="user-content-example-3"      FooModuleRewireAPI.__ResetDependency__('message');   });});"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-v">FooModule</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span Therefore prefer the following order:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{  "plugins": ["istanbul", "rewire"]}"><pre>{  <span class="pl-ent">"plugins"</span>: [<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>istanbul<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>rewire<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>]}</pre></div><p dir="auto">For a project integrating karma, babel, babel-plugin-rewire and istanbul please see <a href="https://github.com/jseminck/karma-rewire-istanbul-example">karma-rewire-istanbul-example</a></p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><a href="https://github.com/douglasduteil/isparta">isparta</a></h3><a id="user-content-isparta" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: isparta" href="#isparta"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">There are some things to consider when using babel-plugin-rewire together with isparta. Since isparta runs Babel itself it's important to remember to add the same configuration options to it as you would do with Babel. If you forget this you will in some cases see unexpected errors.</p><p dir="auto">If you use <em>.babelrc</em> it's advised that you run your tests with a specific ENV, for example "test", and add the following to your <em>.babelrc</em>.Furthermore in case you use isparta only add the plugin once in the isparta loader and not in the babel loader as well.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=""env": {  "test": {    "plugins": ["rewire"]  }}"><pre><span dependencies</li><li>0.1.2 Added __set__ and __get__ to provide compatibility with rewire.js</li><li>0.1.3 Added handling for the export of named declarations like classes or functions</li><li>0.1.4 Fixed variable handling and used renaming of scope variables. Further removed global identifiers to prevent memory leaks.</li><li>0.1.5 Fixed regression</li><li>0.1.6 Support for rewiring top level variables. Added module.exports for non-es6 modules.</li><li>0.1.7 Fixed regressions from 0.1.6.</li><li>0.1.8 Ignores destructuring assignments to prevent errors.</li><li>0.1.9 Removed issues with TDZ and es6.spec.blockScoping optional transformer.</li><li>0.1.10 Fixed tests.</li><li>0.1.11 Fixed issues with for-of loops.</li><li>0.1.12 Updated Plugin Format.</li><li>0.1.13 Changed rewire specific properties on default export to non-enumerable properties.</li><li>0.1.14 Added handling for non-enumerable properties to commonjs support. Support for mixed es6 and commonjs support. Handling for primitive types.</li><li>0.1.15 Added functionality to rewire functions.</li><li>0.1.16 Fixed variable scope for rewired functions.</li><li>0.1.17 Fixed variable scoping for var variable declarations.</li><li>0.1.18 Fixed function scope for rewired functions.</li><li>0.1.19 Removed debug statements.</li><li>0.1.20 Added rewiring named exported functions and variables.</li><li>0.1.21 Improved default export handling, fixed commonjs default exporting, fixed ast nodes resource leaks, improved README.</li><li>0.1.22 Added support for asynchronous functions</li><li>0.1.23-beta Improved flow compatibility, Added functionality to work with cyclic dependencies.</li><li>1.0.0-beta-1 Added support for babel 6, added support for rewiring classes, added support for flow types, added support for rewire.js compatible _<em>with_</em></li><li>1.0.0-beta-2 Removed rewire of Object, require</li><li>1.0.0-beta-3 Removed support for rewiring of globals. Added support for rewiring in combination with assignment and update expressions.</li><li>1.0.0-beta-4 Updates jsx support in combination with babel 6 but has a regression</li><li>1.0.0-beta-5 Fixes rewiring of jsx elements. Readme improvements. Test for pass-through like modules.</li><li>1.0.0-rc-1 Fixes rewiring of switch statements. Readme improvements. Wildcard imports and tdz issues.</li><li>1.0.0-rc-2 Fixes issues with babelify, React stateless functions as well as flow declarations.</li><li>1.0.0-rc-3 Added support for ignoring identifiers and support for objects as parameter to _<em>set_</em></li><li>1.0.0-rc-4 Support for rewiring to undefined, suppport for should.js and cleaned up package.json.</li><li>1.0.0-rc-5 Improved support for rewiring JSX-Components. Further improved for working in combination with other plugins.</li><li>1.0.0-rc-6 Fixed regression which can occur with variable declarators and function expressions. Fixed handling of default exports containing nested functions.</li><li>1.0.0-rc-7 Added revert function as a return of _<em>set_</em> calls.</li><li>1.0.0 Fixed regression with object methods and improved istanbul documentation.</li><li>1.2.0-rc.1 Add support for babel 7, object spread and revert function from __set__ with object and fixes undefined variable error</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Contributors</h2><a id="user-content-contributors" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Contributors" href="#contributors"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><ul dir="auto"><li><a href="https://github.com/speedskater">speedskater</a> -
